title: Learning Design Decision-Making Workshop: A Practical Approach for Language Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language learning experience and digital device proficiency
context.additional_context: A language education course conducted in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment, featuring asynchronous activities and discussions via LMS, with an emphasis on summative assessment for verifying learning outcomes.

learning_goals: Learners can explain how to utilize theoretical foundations (e.g., language acquisition theories) when designing learning activities.
Learners apply a process to evaluate and improve their instructional designs based on peer feedback.
Learners execute collaborative methods to share instructional design cases and experiential knowledge via online platforms (LMS).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
